stanza.line: Your love and pity doth th' impression (a)fill(/a)
Which vulgar scandal stamped upon my (b)brow(/b)
For what care I who calls me well or (a)ill(/a)
So you o'er-green my bad my good (b)allow(/b)
You are my all the world and I must (c)strive(/c)
To know my shames and praises from your (d)tongue(/d)
None else to me nor I to none (c)alive(/c)
That my steeled sense or changes right or (d)wrong(/d)
In so profound abysm I throw all (e)care(/e)
Of others' voices that my adder's (f)sense(/f)
To critic and to flatterer stopped (e)are(/e)
Mark how with my neglect I do (f)dispense(/f)
You are so strongly in my purpose (g)bred(/g)
That all the world besides methinks are (g)dead(/g)
